content.display_text: hover over a setting for more information

elements.tooltip: Change the way you control TETR.PY.

buttons.tooltip: The standard controls, as seen in many stacker games.
A WASD based layout, that sets piece movement to the left hand and rotation to the right.
Custom controls - set them as you wish.

elements.tooltip: Change the keybinding scheme.
Try out these settings.
Reset these settings to their default values.
Change how TETR.PY feels.

elements.title: ARR
elements.dialog_message: The time interval between each automatic repeat movement a tetromino performs when holding down the movement keys, measured in ms.
elements.tooltip: Auto Repeat Rate: The time interval between each automatic repeat movement a tetromino performs when holding down the movement keys, measured in ms.

elements.title: DAS
elements.dialog_message: The time interval between the initial key press and the automatic repeat movement, measured in ms.
elements.tooltip: Delayed Auto Shift: The time interval between the initial key press and the automatic repeat movement, measured in ms.

elements.title: DCD
elements.dialog_message: If non-zero, any ongoing DAS movement will pause for a set amount of time after dropping or rotating a piece, measured in ms.
elements.tooltip: DAS Cut Delay: If non-zero, any ongoing DAS movement will pause for a set amount of time after dropping or rotating a piece, measured in ms.

elements.title: SDF
elements.dialog_message: The factor the soft drop key scales the current gravity by.
elements.tooltip: Soft Drop Factor: The factor the soft drop key scales the current gravity by.
When a piece locks on its own, the hard drop key is disabled for a few frames to prevent accidental hard drops.
When changing directions the DAS charge is reset.
At very high speeds, the soft drop action will be performed before horizontal movement.
The most recent direction input will be prioritised when multiple directions are pressed.
Tweak the music randomiser to your liking.
Change the way TETR.PY sounds.

elements.title: MUSIC
elements.dialog_message: The volume at which music and jingles play.
elements.tooltip: The volume at which music and jingles play.

elements.title: SFX
elements.dialog_message: The volume at which sound effects play.
elements.tooltip: The volume at which sound effects play.

elements.title: stereo
elements.dialog_message:
The stereo balance of the left and right channels.
Larger values increase the difference between the left and right channels.
elements.tooltip: The stereo balance of the left and right channels. Larger values increase the difference between the left and right channels.
Whether to allow scrolling ingame (or holding ALT and scrolling anywhere) to change the volume.
If enabled, the background music will be muted when TETR.PY is minimised or tabbed away.
Whether to play a sound effect that signifies the next piece to spawn in.
Whether to hear the sound effects of of other players in multiplayer games.
Whether  to hear the sound effects of sent and received attacks in multiplayer games.

elements.text: do not reset music when retrying
elements.tooltip: If enabled, the background music won't be reset when retrying a game.
If enabled, no audio will ever play. This will speed up the game, with a rather obvious drawback.
Change the way TETR.PY functions.

elements.title: ACTION TEXT

buttons.tooltip: Don't display any action text when doing special attacks.
Display only non-distracting action text when doing special attacks.
Display all action text when doing special attacks.

elements.tooltip: Change the amount of action text that is displayed when doing special attacks.

elements.title: board bounciness
elements.dialog_message: How much the board reacts when you move pieces around.
elements.tooltip: How much the board reacts when you move pieces around.

elements.title: damage shakiness
elements.dialog_message: How much the board reacts when you recieve damage.
elements.tooltip: How much the board reacts when you recieve damage.

elements.title: grid visibility
elements.dialog_message: How visible the grid of the matrix is, 0% is invisible.
elements.tooltip: How visible the grid of the matrix is, 0% is invisible.

elements.title: board visibility
elements.dialog_message: How visible the board is, 0% is invisible.
elements.tooltip: How visible the board is, 0% is invisible.

elements.title: shadow visibility
elements.dialog_message: How visible the shadow of the current tetromino is, 0% is invisible.
elements.tooltip: How visible the shadow of the current tetromino is, 0% is invisible.

elements.title: board zoom
elements.dialog_message: How large the board displays, values above 100% may cause the board to be cut off.
elements.tooltip: How large the board displays, values above 100% may cause the board to be cut off.
Whether to display a duel side-by-side, this causes your board to be shifted to the left slightly.

elements.text: spin the board when you spin a piece
elements.tooltip: When enabled, the board reacts to spins by rotating a little bit in the direction of the spin.

elements.text: alert me when i KO someone
elements.tooltip: If enabled, show a popup when you KO someone or you get KO'd.

elements.text: warn me when i'm in danger
elements.tooltip: If enabled, the board will turn red and a warning sound will play when you're in danger.
If enabled, the shadow piece will be coloured to match the piece it represents.
If enabled, the held piece will be greyed out when it's locked.
Change the way TETR.PY looks.

elements.title: GRAPHICS

buttons.tooltip: Disable everything (including textures) for the highest performance but worst visuals.
No particles, effects, or animations. Use this for better performance, or if you simply dislike the flare.
Less particles and effects. Remove any non-gameplay related particles and effects

elements.tooltip: The grahical quality preset to be used.

elements.title: target fps
elements.dialog_message: The target frame rate the game will try to achieve.
elements.tooltip: The target frame rate the game will try to achieve.

elements.title: particle count
elements.dialog_message: The number of particles to display.
elements.tooltip: The number of particles to display.

elements.title: background visibility
elements.dialog_message: How visible the background images are, 0% makes the background entirely black.
elements.tooltip: How visible the background images are, 0% makes the background entirely black.

elements.title: GUI scale
elements.dialog_message: The size of the GUI elements, 100% is the default size.
elements.tooltip: The size of the GUI elements, 100% is the default size.

elements.title: RENDER SCALING

buttons.tooltip: Turn off render scaling, and render the game at the current resolution of the window.
Apply render scaling, but adjust the internal resolution of the game when fullscreen is toggled.
Apply render scaling, but lock the internal resolution of the game to a set value.

elements.tooltip: WARNING EXPERIMENTAL: Visual artifacts and other bugs may occur! Render the game at a lower internal resolution which is then upscaled using hardware acceleration. This can increase performance even when the render scale is set to 100%.

elements.title: render scale
elements.dialog_message: The factor of the windows resolution that the game is rendered at. Lower values will increase performance, but increase pixelation.
elements.tooltip: The factor of the windows resolution that the game is rendered at. Lower values will increase performance, but increase pixelation.
Whether to enable fullscreen mode.
If enabled, the boards of other players will always be simplified. This will increase performance, but looks less nice.
If enabled, the background will not be rendered when in menus. This will majorly increase performance, however you will no longer see the backgrounds.
If enabled, the replay tools do not collapse when you're not using them.

elements.text: warn me when the game is not focused
elements.tooltip: If enabled, a warning is displayed when TETR.PY is not in focus.
Add your own personal spin to TETR.PY.
Whether to use provided custom backgrond image(s).

elements.title: BLOCK SKIN

buttons.tooltip: Use the default textures for the tetromino blocks.
Draw the tetromino blocks as a singular solid colour, this is more performant as no textures are used.
Use a provided custom texture for the tetromino blocks.

elements.tooltip: Change the way the tetromino blocks look.

sub_text.display_text: save a .cfg file of your config that you can drag into TETR.PY to import

text.display_text: tweak your settings for a better TETR.PY experience
